sentences.english: This was a mark of great shame and disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 這在當時是恥辱與不光彩的標誌。

sentences.english: You can not only beautify the environment, in order to add a luster to the world.
sentences.chinese: 你不僅可以美化環境，爲世界增添一份光彩。

sentences.english: You won't dignify the house just by painting it.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅通過粉刷房子不會給房子增添光彩。

sentences.english: He is ashamed for his former dishonorable action.
sentences.chinese: 他對他以前不光彩的行爲感到羞愧。

sentences.english: 'A friend will add beauty to your life, Like a sweet scented flower.
sentences.chinese: 朋友就像芬芳怡人的鮮花，總會爲你的生活增添光彩。

sentences.english: The girls were diked out in their best.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘們穿着最漂亮的衣服，打扮得光彩照人。

sentences.english: Modesty is not only and ornament, but also a guard to virtue.
sentences.chinese: 謙遜不僅可增添光彩也可以維護美德。

sentences.english: The author tried to depict the splendor of the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 作家試圖摹寫落日的光彩。

sentences.english: To provide images, allows you to add luster to the shop.
sentences.chinese: 提供圖片，讓您的店鋪增添光彩。

sentences.english: North flocks old tenants left Beijing property market why splendor faded?
sentences.chinese: 成羣老住戶的離開京北樓市爲何光彩褪色？

sentences.english: The cloud stood humbly in a corner of the sky, The morning crowned it with splendour.
sentences.chinese: 黑雲謙真天站正在天涯，晨曦給它披上燦素的光彩。

sentences.english: Manna in cobweb lusters with lightness.
sentences.chinese: 蛛網上的甘露光彩輕盈。

sentences.english: The sun was shining with uncommon lustre.
sentences.chinese: 太陽放射出異常的光彩。

sentences.english: Love you and Miss you in this moment.
sentences.chinese: 感覺小左你我既世界就會失去光彩。

sentences.english: Let us move, add luster for the expo.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們一起行動起來，爲世博增添光彩。

sentences.english: Now you've come, you try to do right and be a credit to us.
sentences.chinese: 你現在即來了，就得好好兒幹，讓我們臉上也光彩。

definition: Guangze county in Nanping 南平[Nan2 ping2] Fujian
